alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Claiborne; Jackson; Lincoln; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:23PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Webster, northwestern Jackson, southeastern Claiborne, northeastern Bienville and Lincoln Parishes through 815 PM CST... At 722 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Homer to 7 miles southeast of Heflin. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruston, Grambling, Arcadia, Gibsland, Dubach, Simsboro, Vienna, Athens, Bienville, Lisbon, Bryceland, Mount Lebanon, Mount Zion, Aycock, Spring Lake, Sailes, Lake Clairborne, Corinth, Unionville and Ada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for north central and northwestern Louisiana.
